tripreview.Title: "Interesting with a guide"
tripreview.sentence: Our guide took us here and it was interesting to hear the history and find out more about the Synagogue and the issues that the Jewish community have in arranging 'services' there as there are not enough male members of the community these days.
No photography allowed, glad we visited but do make sure you have someone with you who can help bring it to life for you.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place"
tripreview.sentence: its an ancient synagogue and when I visited, it was closed.
Spent some time outside and did some shopping on the antique items.

tripreview.Title: "Okay place..... Good fr Street shopping. "
tripreview.sentence: Did not really get to see the monument from inside coz apparently on of the last few Jew's left (5) had passed away that day
So now there are are only 4 kews left there
The place has some very good antique collection stores n good places fr street shopping like junk jewellery n stuff
Overall if ur short on tym u can skip da place.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting Place"
tripreview.sentence: This synagogue in Jew town is an interesting place to visit as it gives the history of the Jewish settlement in India.
The only draw back is the vendors on the access street to the synagogue itself.
Very peaceful and tranquil inside.

tripreview.Title: "A Historic Monument in Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: The Paradesi Synagogue is a small structure which has great value as a historic monument in Cochin.
This place of Jewish worship built around 300 years back is very well maintained.
The painting on thew all adequately communicate the history of Jewish settlement in Kerala and the Synagogue.
Visitors must not miss the blue floor tiles each with a unique design and the chandeliers.
The authorities must keep this place open throughout the week to avoid disappointing tourists.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting Historic Place"
tripreview.sentence: Not an imposing structure, but a very interesting historic place.
The details are well depicted.
Only annoying factor is the local tourist guides talking and reading out loudly.
Centuries old structure.
Walk peacefully.
Sit inside for some time.
On the way to the synagogue many interesting stores.
and they all display "Hassle Free"

tripreview.Title: "Historical Synagogue filled with Treasures."
tripreview.sentence: Paradesi Synagogue,is one of the oldest Syngogue in the world,situated at Jew Street, Kochi,India.
This was one among 7 ( Sevan), Synagogue's build by the Jewish community in Kerala.

This Synagogue is situated at Jew street and is named ' Paradesi Synagogue', since, Paradesi is word normally referred in many Indian languages for Foreigners, and since this Synagogue was build by Spanish Speaking Jews /white Jews,considered as foreigners ( Jewish community in Kerala has long history and so there are many sections of the Jewish communities flourished,since this specific review pertains to Synagogue, discussions/reviews w.r.t. Jew community is not considered here).
The moment one enters the Synagogue main hall,one will be stunt to see the variety of antique objects and beautiful glass chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.
The best part of the Synagogue is it's,unusually beautiful designer floor tiles (it seems this tiles were procured from China).
There is a pulpit (stage) made of brass rails occupying the centre of the room.

The Synagogue has managed to preserve,some of the Old Testaments and many Gold coins and Gold crowns received as gifts (As an appreciation of the community)from local rulers and among the historical collection is a Copper plate belonging to the 4th century, with inscriptions in Malayalam.
I could not go inside this time since it was a saturday and the inside details furnished are based on my earlier visit to the place.
While the Synagogue looks so simple from outside,is a treasure house inside,and a definite place recommended for a visit.
The Synagogue remain open from 10.00am to 12.00noon and 3.00pm to 5.00pm and remain closed on Fridays and Saturdays.
With strict conformity to the traditions,the entry to Synagogue is with bare feet only.

tripreview.Title: "A beautiful small synagogue, the oldest existing in continuous cult"
tripreview.sentence: This is the second time I visit, this time with my husband and my daughter.

There were many tourists, but all enthralled by the quiet place, the beautiful light, and the great abundance of old glass chandeliers/lamps, as well as by the beautiful blue and white tiles of the floor.
It is a pity that the resident Jewish population has dwindled to a mere 6 people (they were 13, the last time I was there).

Our suggestion is that Israel should send some of it supernumerary religious youths (who anyway do not do the military service) to Kochi to either settle or participate for a given time in the life of the small community, who is obliged to ask a rabbi to come from elsewhere when they need to perform special functions.

tripreview.Title: "First visit for 46 years!"
tripreview.sentence: I came here in 1970 and had a wonderful experience, but now the place is much too touristy.
You have to pay to enter the Synagogue and it's packed with people, photography's not allowed, and the treasures which I saw in 1970 have been hidden away.
I found it rather sad.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting"
tripreview.sentence: An intersting place to visit.
Sadly though there are very few Jews left in Kochi.
It has beautiful had painted floor tiles and many other intersting artifacts.
Well worth a visit.

tripreview.Title: "Cochin Synagogue"
tripreview.sentence: This Synagogue at Cochin is the oldest one in India, with few hundred Jews still staying nearby, 17th Century made, when Jews migrated to Cochin.
Well maintained and it speaks the classical art work of Middle east.
The Spices merchants street is nearby where most the Jews were traders and still holding export trading.
Cochin visitors should make it a point to visit this Synagogue once, I had visited this place couple of times to show my guests from Europe.

tripreview.Title: "Synagogue"
tripreview.sentence: Nothing much to see and a very small place.
I felt it was a waste of time.
Its better to visit the small shops there.

tripreview.Title: "Mattancherry Synagogue"
tripreview.sentence: The word Paradesi means foreigner in many Indian languages.
It refers to the White Jews - A mixture of Jews from Kodungalloor, Middle East and Europe.
The Jewish synagogue was built in 1568, almost 1500 years after the beginning of the Jewish connection with Kerala.
It was built on the land, adjacent to the Mattancherry Palace, given by the erstwhile king of Cochin.
The Paradesi Synagogue, in a corner of Jew Town, is more than a hundred years old and houses many rare antiques.
The synagogue, that woos many visitors, adds to the quaint charm of Mattancherry.

tripreview.Title: "Recomend"
tripreview.sentence: An Interesting place that shows the great past of the jewish community in cocci.
The chinese ceramics on the floor is unique and very beautiful eventhough it was purly put.

tripreview.Title: "Good for History buffs"
tripreview.sentence: My first visit to a synagogue from the inside.
Was curious to see the insides of a Jewish place of worship, since they r so rare in India.
Well kept.
Built in 1568 so has a lot of history which you can read about in a little room to the right before entering the synagogue.
The floor tiles were awesome.
A prayerful atmosphere.
And do try to reach before 1pm or after 3pm as it is closed for 2 hrs during that time.

tripreview.Title: "Great look back at history"
tripreview.sentence: Nice look at the ancient history of Cochin and the Jewish heritage.
A very different look at a synagogue compared to the more modern ones I've visited.

tripreview.Title: "A Cultural Experience "
tripreview.sentence: This Synagogue was built in 1568 in Jew Town courtesy of the then Maharaja of Travancore.
He was well disposed towards the Jewish migrants and the synagogue is the first in India.
It is well maintained and the entry fee is a token 5 Rupees per person.
The lady taking our fee is a Jew herself and told us only 5 Jews remain in Cochin today.
Not really much to see but one does get an appreciation of the history of Jew Town from a collection of portraits.
The actual temple is fascinating and the Chinese tiles on the floor have intricate designs - no two tiles have the same design.
It was very humid but the fans were switched off - not sure if they were in working order.
A few tourists with tour guides were also visiting when we were there which indicates it is a popular tourist attraction.

tripreview.Title: "Grand Church"
tripreview.Userloc: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
tripreview.sentence: One of the most historical places in Cochin was built by Portuguese and became Cathedral in 1558 which was destroyed during British period.
However new building was made in 1887.
This was declared Basilica in 1984.
Perhaps the finest Catholic Church in Kerala, it has great architecture.

tripreview.Title: "Landmark of Fort Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: A church that recalls the golden era of colonial days
wonderful architecture

tripreview.Title: "Oldest Cathedral in India"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful and elegant decorations in this well preserved old church.
Many people were praying in the Cathedral when I entered.
There were several grottoes containing beautiful statues of saints.
It was one of the few Christian churches I saw in India.
It is an active church, with daily and Sunday masses for local and visiting Catholics.
There is a large Catholic School which is open to children of all faiths.
It has very high standards, and high tuition, as well.
Children who graduate with high grades, from this school have a good chance to gain admittance to Indian universities.

tripreview.Title: "Very Beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: Santa Cruz Basilica is one of the most beautiful places you can go in Kochi area.
IN and OUT of the building is so beautiful.

tripreview.Title: "Nice church"
tripreview.sentence: I was there many times.
They have also mass in english.
The chuch is very beautiful with a lot of history.

tripreview.Title: "The Catholic heart of Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: Our group's walkabout around Fort Cochin this morning took us to this historic basilica.
Unfortunately the church was closed and the entrance gates shut.
One of our group who is born and bred in Cochin explained the history and significance of the church for the local Catholic community.
We walked right around the perimeter including the school and had a good photo opportunity.
I would have liked to visit the church itself and its interior.
Perhaps another time

tripreview.Title: "Worth a quick visit"
tripreview.sentence: Nice old church, full of some classic gimcrack Catholic gee-gaws (I'm Catholic myself!).
I particularly liked the statue of Mary with the illuminated rosary.

tripreview.Title: "Worth a look"
tripreview.sentence: Like anything religious in India there seems to be money to keep them in good order, this Basilica is no exception.
It stands tall amongst the rest of the nearby buildings.
On the night we were there it was standing room only, people were everywhere.

tripreview.Title: "Well kept and impressive church"
tripreview.sentence: Really beautiful church, inside and out.
Nice stained glass windows.
It was so quiet and peaceful.
Try to visit if you can, normal to do it during a day trip around cochin.

tripreview.Title: "Catholic centre of Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: A large historic church built by the Portuguese at the centre of Fort Kochi.
It is set in a large compound with a school on one side and, surprisingly, a BSNL telephone exchange.
The church has a lot of frescoes painted on the walls and high ceiling.
The altar backdrop has Christ rising through blue sky and clouds.

tripreview.Title: "Nice Basilica but I've seen far better"
tripreview.sentence: A nice old building almost in the centre of town.
Beautifully ornamentally decorated but not spectacular or a wow factor to really call it a tourist attraction.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place. Worth a short visit on way to the Boat Wharf"
tripreview.sentence: Good Place.
Worth a short visit on way to the Boat Wharf while wrapping up your day at Fort Kochi / Mattancherry Island.
The nearby Indo-Portugese museum is also worth a very short trip.
Church interiors are very nice and quiet.
Worth taking a short break and allotting some time to God.

tripreview.Title: "Well preserved"
tripreview.sentence: Heritage church well manteined with good cultural inscriptions in a few old stones and informaticos from portuguese and dutch time.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely church!"
tripreview.sentence: Lovely church in fort kochi - really interesting to see an Indian twist on a church, really liked the inside.
Need to sign in before you enter.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place to visit"
tripreview.sentence: If you like history and architecture, this is the place to go.
Very beautiful atmosphere which gives you the passage of time.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely church"
tripreview.sentence: Great for lovers of architecture and to understand the history of the church in Kerala, from the very beginning to nowadays!
We visited at sunset, which made it also romantic!

tripreview.Title: "Gothic and splendid"
tripreview.sentence: One of 8 Basilicas.
This is the finest and most impressive.
artistic and grand built by the Portuguese originally.
1886 rebuilt, 2 spires pastel interior with frescoes on the coloms.
Beautiful stained glass windows and painting of the last supper.
I thought this was splendid, wooden pews and very different interior, lively.
Vasco de Gama had been buried here.

tripreview.Title: "A nice sight but nothing special"
tripreview.sentence: The basilica is pretty and well-maintained.
It is not a tourist hotspot so you won't find it crowded.
It is centrally located so you will likely pass it anyway.
The building itself is nothing exceptional.
The surrounding area is not very well-maintained and rickshaw drivers may hassle you, so it is not the most relaxing experience overall.

tripreview.Title: "Meh - Not that Attractive or Interesting"
tripreview.sentence: If you're excited about seeing where Vasco da Gama was buried for a short while before being disinterred, this is your place.
There's a nice alter, but it wasn't enough to be worth the stop for us.

tripreview.Title: "Better than the cathedral in Rome (I'm being partial)"
tripreview.sentence: One of the oldest standing Basilica's in Cochin.
Tall and majestic in structure with detailed stone and art work depicting Christ's journey and work.
The inside of the Basilica is a cool sanctuary and oasis from the outside world.

tripreview.Title: "Great place for serenity and meditation"
tripreview.sentence: One of the must spots to visit when you come to Kochi - beautifully maintained and a serene place for meditation.

tripreview.Title: "nice but religious bigotry by one person"
tripreview.sentence: We were entering the church and man inside told us we couldn't enter because we aren't Catholics.
We asked if there's any such rule and he kept quiet.
Then he went on to tell us that non-Catholics should come bare feet.
I told him there isn't anything written outside.
He was plain stupid.
I didn't feel like going there again even though I love churches.

tripreview.Title: "Worth a visit"
tripreview.sentence: You can walk around in Fort Kochi and visit most of the places.
We first went at 1.30 p.m. and found it closed.
We came back after 2:30 pm when it opens again.
Volunteers were decorating the church for Christmas celebrations.
We sat there for some time, taking in the peace and quiet.
You will have to remove your footwear here too.

tripreview.Title: "Nice to visit once"
tripreview.sentence: I liked the place.
Not like you would miss anything great if not visiting, but nice to visit once.
It is at Fort Kochi, so no need to go far to visit this place and doesn't take much time too.

tripreview.Title: "Small but beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: Its an old church very near the Fort Kochi beach.
There is a weird memorial type of thing with a blue dome right beside it.
Behind it lies a girls school.
The facade is typical Indo Portuguese, you can see similar facades in Goa.
The interior has some nice paintings and decorations.
It remains closed in the afternoon for a couple of hours.

tripreview.Title: "worth visit"
tripreview.sentence: u can visit to see vasco de gamma
otherwise not much to see there
and local market is v small but u can buy something from there for sure

tripreview.Title: "Interesting old Church and should be on your list of things to see"
tripreview.sentence: Nothing spectacular, but still worth visiting to see.
Old church and those are not so common when tracvelling India so worth taking some time to see this, and others, while visiting Cochin.

tripreview.Title: "Impressive."
tripreview.sentence: We lived just around the corner from this Basilica and I actually visited it twice even If I am not a religious person at all, just to feel the atmosphere within this building which was rather unique - it was a place of contemplation and quietness and in this turbulent world these days it is worth wile to visit this place.

tripreview.Title: "It's a basilica in all sense"
tripreview.sentence: yes of course to pray, it has a calm ambiance
the interiors are so attractive with the colonial architectural style, the painting, the altar and seating arrangements are beyond words.

tripreview.Title: "Santa Cruz Basilica"
tripreview.sentence: The grand historical structure takes your back on the pages of the past.
The interior of the church is so overwhelming with arches and inspiring art.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: This church is located within the premises of a school in Fort Kochi.
It's a huge and grand structure.
Very peaceful place for worship.
It is one of the finest and most beautiful church in India.
It seems simple on the outside but is magnificent from inside.
A must visit in kochi.
The church is closed in the afternoon from around 1-3pm.

tripreview.Title: "Impressive church"
tripreview.sentence: It is one of eight basilicas in India and quite impressive among other Indian churches.
Looks simple from the outside but is very beautiful inside.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful Church - A Must See"
tripreview.sentence: I certainly didn't expect to see such a beautiful church in India.
Simple on the outside but the inside is just amazing.
You cannot compare this to the churches I have seen in Prague.
It is of a smaller and simpler scale but nevertheless, it is still beautiful.
This is certainly the highlight of my stay in Fort Kochi.
I spent quite a bit of time here to soak in the beauty.
This is a must see really.
Do make a donation for the maintenance of the church on your way out ;) Thanks.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful church"
tripreview.sentence: An architectually interesting Catholic church with a gorgeous interior.
One of the definite highlights of our stay in Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Wow!! Oldest Catholic Church in India"
tripreview.sentence: I had no idea that Catholicism left such a big imprint on Fort Kochi.
This was a remarkable experience walking through this church.
It is also a girl's school and in the afternoon they would just squeal "Hellloooo!
with pure delight in their best English!
It was so cute - all had matching braids and uniforms.
The Basilica itself was very old but beautifully maintained.
Doesn't take long to stop in and see.

tripreview.Title: "Ancient Architecture"
tripreview.sentence: This is a really a pretty old church which has that looks and feel.
You should visit here during the Christmas time.

tripreview.Title: "Clean and well maintained"
tripreview.sentence: It's a place of worship.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place"
tripreview.sentence: Place to stay for 20 minutes.
Nothing very special.
Strange techicue to imitate marblea and ceramic tiles.
Nice ceiling with interesting paintings.
Good to visit by the way.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful interiors."
tripreview.sentence: One on the finest church I have visited.
The interiors are just spell bounding.
The place is so serene that you can sit inside for hours.

tripreview.Title: "Nice church, but fake painted marble effect and plastic figurines"
tripreview.sentence: Nice church and pleasant church service.
Unfortunately, instead of keeping the original materials of cement and wood, they have decided to paint it with marble effect and give an overall 'tacky' feel.
Despite this, it provides a very localised authentic experience.
Having been invited by a local to attend, it was a great experience.

tripreview.Title: "A Must Visit"
tripreview.sentence: Nice church.
very peacful.
A must see for a tourist.
Many historical facts n the carving n painting on walls are really to b caputred.
Very beautiful.

tripreview.Title: "Great architecture"
tripreview.sentence: Medieval churches like these are always a delight for those who are interested in architecture.
Important scenes in Jesus life are represented on the high walls.
Entire church is very well maintained.

tripreview.Title: "A must see place"
tripreview.sentence: Lovely old church that shows the colonial past and multi faith nature of Kerala.
A must see attraction.

tripreview.Title: "Absolutely Divine"
tripreview.sentence: My heartfelt thanks to whomsoever who recomended this place to me.
Felt completely at peace and fulfilled.
Wonderful place.
Must visit again.

tripreview.Title: "A magnificent structure with awesome architecture"
tripreview.sentence: The Santa Cruz Cathedral Basilica at Fort Kochi is one of the eight Basilicas in India.
Counted as one of the heritage edifices of Kerala, this church is one of the finest and most impressive churches in India and visited by tourists the whole year round.
It is a place of devotion as well as a center of historic significance, endowed with architectural and artistic grandeur and colours of the gothic style.
The basilica serves as the Cathedral church of the Diocese of Cochin.
The church was built originally by the Portuguese and elevated to a Cathedral by Pope Paul IV in 1558, was spared by the Dutch conquerors who destroyed many Catholic buildings.
Later the British demolished the structure and Bishop D. Joao Gomes Ferreira commissioned a new building in 1887.
Consecrated in 1905, Santa Cruz was proclaimed a Basilica by Pope John Paul II in 1984.

tripreview.Title: "Shocked - closed on a Sunday"
tripreview.sentence: We reached this famous place more than 500 years old Santa Cruz Basillica in Cochin India.
Shocked and disappointed to find it closed, that too on a Sunday; so all we could do was to click a few pics from the outside as memory of having been here.
A tip for tourists if you are to go there on a Sunday make sure to reach before 11.30am.
